course.title: Nature
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., at 1, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: Ethical relations among people have always implied (whether directly or covertly) a preferred connection between people and nature. This course offers a critical and historical analysis of selected texts that identify human beings as a distinctively ethical species within the natural world, with particular attention to the emergence of normative theories that rank people with and against other natural beings. Topics include: definitions of wilderness and property; social hierarchies based on "natural" differences; agriculture, modern science, industrialization, and consumer economies as historic redefinitions of the human place within nature; animal rights; and environmentalism and its critics.
